node.title: SA on track to further ease COVID-19 restrictions by the end of the year
node.alt: SA Police Commissioner Grant Stevens addresses the media.
node.description: South Australia will likely further ease its coronavirus restrictions between Christmas and New Year's Eve, but the emergence of the Omicron strain means the state may not be as free as previously proposed.
node.content:
["South Australia will likely further ease its coronavirus restrictions between Christmas and New Year's Eve, but the emergence of the Omicron strain means the state may not be as free as previously proposed.", "After a meeting of the state's COVID Transition Committee this morning, Police Commissioner Grant Stevens said he would be in a position to announce the next phase of the state's COVID-Ready Plan\u00a0by Friday.", "He said the opening date would most likely be between Christmas and the end of the year.", "\"I was hopeful that it was going to be before, but the indicators are at this stage it will be after Christmas but before the end of this year,\" Commissioner Stevens said.", "The state government had contemplated the next stage of opening would take place once 90 per cent of the population aged 12 and over was fully vaccinated.", "Currently 84.2 per cent of the population is.", "The government had forecast in October that the next stage of the opening plan would see quarantine requirements lifted altogether for fully-vaccinated domestic and international arrivals.", "The plan also forecast restrictions, including mask-wearing, would be lifted on most activities.", "High-risk activities including dancing at nightclubs, and standing and drinking, would be reserved for fully-vaccinated people.", "But Mr Stevens suggested there may be some movement in those plans, with quarantine requirements for international arrivals, and venue limits still under consideration.", "\"We haven't landed on what full capacity looks like,\" he said.", "\"There will be different variations for different types of activities, but we're trying to make it as simple as possible and provide as much latitude as possible for businesses to operate and take advantage of the relaxation.", "However, the Police Commissioner ruled out a widespread vaccine mandate.", "\"The very strong advice from the Chief Public Health Officer is not to mandate vaccinations beyond the very few sectors that have already been included in a mandate,\" Commissioner Stevens said.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
